definition: to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
to depict/to trace (a drawing)/to copy/to touch up

sentences.english: Traditionally, prose lays emphasis on the description of the objective world and didactical instructions.
sentences.chinese: 传统散文重在对客观世界的描摹和对读者的“教化”。

sentences.english: There is "ice play" painting by Qing Dynasty painter at the National Palace Museum.
sentences.chinese: 故宫至今藏有清代宫廷画师描摹的《冰嬉图》。

sentences.english: They were sketched out full size on paper.
sentences.chinese: 这些画按原尺寸描摹了出来。

sentences.english: Concentrate on discussing the PVP effect to silver nanometer structure shape appearance.
sentences.chinese: 重点会商PVP对纳米构造银地描摹地影响。

definition: brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
to trace over/to copy (a calligraphy model)/facsimile/(fig.) to depict/to portray
to draw the outline of/to outline/to sketch/to delineate contours of/to give a brief account of
to express (emotions in prose)/a written description (of emotions)
the wording and purport of what one writes
to appear vividly on paper (idiom); to show forth vividly (in writing, painting etc)/to stand out markedly
